description: This place has alright  food and is super clean. My go to order is the Portuguese   baked chicken rice.
author: Hannah L.

description:
Sometimes one waits for a bus and looks into the restaurant nearby. The bus arrives and one boards. This is about S&E Cafe, the day I ate there since the bus wasn't coming. It was very good.

At first glance of the menu, I could only eat toast and drink milk tea since I'm vegetarian. Luckily I met two Hong Kong people; one shares tables like in Hong Kong. They asked in Chinese for the freshest vegetable, which was bok choy. Later they advised me to order the egg noodles with soy sauce. They also suggested the dry curry with rice noodles, but it was too late to change my order. Next time! 

The bok choy tasted fresh from the market and was flavorful, with a nice balance of garlic. The egg noodles dish was an enormous portion (plenty to take home) and also delicious. The Hong Kong milk tea was very good, and the server was so nice to give me a cup to go on the house. Merry Christmas! It tasted like the milk tea in Hong Kong. 

I will return to try the curried rice noodles, and suggest you stop by when you're in the area, or just waiting for the bus.
author: Carol W.

description: Real deal Hong Kong style food. We ordered off the menu items like sautéed gailan, black bean garlic ginger leek crab, yu choi, and hk style beef ho fun. Good clear broth house soup and taro tapioca dessert in hot coconut soup on the house like the house soup. The crab was live swimming in tank minutes before served to us!
author: Kimi W.

description:
Whoa a HK cafe spot that's actually clean, has friendly waitstaff, and pretty damn tasty food actually exists?! 

Arrived just after 11am to a completely empty restaurant. The waitress was especially patient and understanding, speaking thru her broken English and listening thru my broken Cantonese. We ordered scrambled egg hao fun with fish, baked clams and scallop white sauce rice, and pork rice porridge with Chinese donuts. 

About 5mins after ordering, the waitress came by to tell us the pastry chef was out and they couldn't make the Chinese donut. The buds didn't want rice porridge without Chinese donut, and opted for a seafood soup with the pastry topping, but was told the same thing - pastry dude is OOO. But whyyyy. 

Welp, we got the other two carbs on carbs dishes and it ended up being more than enough. Was honestly pleased with the overall experience, despite the pastry options mishaps. 4 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This place is super yummy! I came with my parents and was probably the youngest person at the cafe. Its a popular place with the elderly so you know this is good old school Hong Kong style food.

My parents ordered the pork chop with veggies and rice and won ton noodle soup. I ordered the curry chicken. The portions are huge and the flavor of everything was delicious! Service was on point--very quick and attentive.

Parking in the area can be difficult because its located on 19th avenue. However, parking is better on the side streets.

FYI--minimum purchase requirement to use credit card here is $15.
author: Janet E.

description:
I haven't been here in a while, but I remembered the good portions and homey feel of the place.  I came by for a second visit in about a year recently because I was looking for dinner before we karaoke it up at VOIZ a few blocks away. They cleaned up the place and everything looks very nice from what I last remember. Maybe it is a fresh coat of paint? 

Hong Kong cafes are in my "comfort food" zone. My favorite is generally the baked pork chop or chicken over spaghetti. They generally make really good scrambled egg over noodles or rice dishes. The last two visits, the scrambled egg "gravy" dishes were tasty. My last visit I had the minced beef with raw egg, which was not bad. I was craving protein so I ordered this dish but the rice was slightly under cooked and the sauce slightly on the bland side. The raw egg was hiding snuggled in the rice under the blanket of hot minced meat sauce. Not a bad choice on a regular day I imagine. 

The servers were busy and running around in haste, but they usually respond to your requests unlike some restaurants where they ignore you usually because of being short staffed or what not. We were able to get refills on tea and the check promptly.
author: David K.

description: Got a lot of seafood inside the soup. Just little salty. The portions are huge. I shared the dishes and still took it to go. There are a lot of TVs. Parking is hard to find. Also the taste is good for various dishes.
author: Cal L.

description: Decent hk htyle food. Their noodles taste very good even without any sauce from the chicken steak. Chicken wings were crispy and ddelicious. However Milk Tea was too dark because they brewed it for the whole day and was too cheap to change the leaves even once.
author: Kevin R.

description: Sorry but I've had better HK baked plates. Macau chicken came out in a huge plate but really lacked depth of flavor. Atmosphere is a bit of your standard homey Chinese joint, complete with semi- sticky tables. Sorry won't be coming back.
author: Cathrin P C.

description:
Is changing seat such impossible in this restaurant???  
Is it changing seat such a BIG matter in your restaurant??
When we (party of 2 ) got into S&E, it's 8:20. Temperature getting cold outside, they still having fan on. We have to set in front of the fan because other tables are not available at that time. After some people finish dinning, there were at lease 3 tables becoming available. We keeping ask if we could change to inside, getting warm. They keeping said no. The boy with glasses said it is complicated for a table already order food to change the table. (Because they are too LAZY doing change on the computer).
It is already around 9pm. Not many people come. With lot of available tables, they finally allowed us change the table UNTIL I CRY!!!! I was feeling sick setting under the fan but they just don't care!
author: Tiffy L.

description: The foods were very good, I pick up to go very often from this place and I usually paid cash if I have them. Because they charge the credit card fee on customer. The waitress told me that the charge was 3%. But they actually charged 5.88%. Well it's not again the law to transfer the charge to customer. But I do think the owner should look for a better rate merchant company. There are a lot of Merchant companies out there only charge 2.4% to 2.7%.
author: Helen L.

description:
REVIEWER 186

Nothing really excited me about this place. I came here with a couple friends during lunch time on a weekday.

Place was pretty packed but luckily we didn't have to wait and plus we had a big table for 7! SCORE!

ATMOSPHERE:
Very spacious restaurant, I liked that they had TV's located in the restaurant. My group and I were able to sit, talk and laugh without people looking at us or judging us. (Which was really nice!)

SERVICE:
Pretty good!  Most of the staff speaks Chinese but luckily my friends were able to speak to them in their language. 

FOOD:
OMG! Huge portions! We decided to share all the dishes and do family style and this worked out really well! We ordered:

- Crispy Chicken Wings. 7\10 they ran out of Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings boo so I had to order the plan wings instead.
-Seafood Vegetables with noodles 7\10
-Singapore Style Chow Fun 8/10
-Shrimp Fried Rice 9/10

The food was good but nothing to brag about. I do like that the food has huge portions. Parking can be a challenge which was the reason we didn't have time to sit and relax (we were too busy timing our meters).

Would I come back again? Yes, but it wouldn't be my first choice. 

HAPPY EATS!

REVIEW 101/196
author: Porsche C.

description:
Decided to take my mother and sister here because it was on the way back to my apartment. After giving this place another try, I decided to bump it up to 4 stars.

There are a few overpriced items (you can get Fujian fried rice off-menu for ~$13), but most of the things I order are around $10. The portion sizes are truly immense, you'll always go home with leftovers. Meals also come with soup and a dessert. (Tonight's dessert was sweet taro soup, yum!)

There's a $3/person minimum, but they take card, which is a plus. 

So I'm giving them that bonus star because if I'm in the area, I would stop by for a ginormous helping of gravy egg ho fun. YUM.
author: Abby W.

description:
Very mediocre Chinese cafe style type of food. This is my second time here and I'll probably come back. I wasn't very hungry so I got the corn chowder with puff pastry. It wasn't anything special. The puff pastry was perfectly baked on the outside but the inside was still dough-y. My brother got the baked clams and sausage spaghetti w/ tomato sauce, this was actually very good! Clams had a weird texture but I don't really have high standards for these places. My dad got deep fried pork cutlets w/ spaghetti. Also nothing special. 

The place was packed during Sunday lunch time. Which was probably why the food came out pretty slow. My brother almost finished his dish before my dad even got his. 

Price was reasonable, came out to $30 for three people (complimentary soup)
author: Nancy C.

description:
Walked in because when I peeked through the windows, it was a full house on a Monday during lunch time. Majority of patrons appear to be retired folks and they each showed a plastic card prior to the meal. 
Most yelpers recommended the HK style pork chop. It's cheap for large portions and the dish come out hot but those are the only upsides. With so many other options on Taraval Street, I won't be returning here.
author: Daniel W.

description:
I am disappointed with their baked rice or spaghetti dishes. Not the way it used to be, which was flavorful and filling. The baked fish and spaghetti with cream sauce ($10.50) barely had any sauce, very bland.

The nice server gave me hot tea while I waited for my to-go food and watched the Warriors game. I ordered the HK style milk tea which I give 5 stars, most places can't make it as tasty as them. But if they don't improve their baked rice/spaghetti dishes, I will only come for their HK milk tea. Sadly, I dropped my milk tea on my way home. =(
author: Lyric A.

description: I literally got here at 12:18 PM and ordered a hk style chicken steak.By the time the food got to the table it was already 12:58 PM.The food was also very greasy and made my lips very shiny and feels like I put on a lip balm.The chicken had lots of fat and fat chicken skin so I had to rip the chicken skin out and spit out the fat parts out.The service was okay ,but you have to ask them like for a tea refill.I have tried better.I won't be coming here anymore.
author: Elle B.

description:
Don't let the name or clientele fool you.
This place can do an excelldnt authentic chinese banquet for you in their upstair room. One of their partners owns a seafood wholesale place, so they can get the freshest seafood for their restaurant. You just have to order in advance. The chef's expertise you won't believe until you've tried. My friends and I eat here regularly. Everything they put in front of you are excellent. Can't say any better than that.
author: Gene L.

description: I asked for water and they said they don't serve ice water at this restaurant. I also asked for a watermelon juice and they hand me orange juice instead. They should have people who speak both  English and Chinese so they understand what people are ordering. Not everyone speaks the same language as them. My past visits were much better but today wasn't as good as before.
author: Caryanne D.

description:
S&E is one of my more frequent HK cafe in the area. It has a huge menu to choose from, for whatever you're craving that day. 

Whatever I order, they never disappoint. Though some dishes may be better than others. But so far, what I've order were very tasty to me, ranging from baked rice to noodles to rice plates. My go-to appetizer is the salt and peppered chicken wings, so do try it!

Overall, great spot for your HK food fix. There are a lot of varieties and everything is super affordable!
author: Wendy Y.

description:
Five stars for service.
Zero star for value.  Order a Beef chow fun with veggies, there was only six pieces of beef(see pic) and you charge me $9?!? Speechless.  
I'll think twice before I'll come back again!
author: JC C.

description:
Hate it hate it Hate it hate it Hate it hate it 
Don't come here F@&$ this place 
They got my order wrong and then fixed it and charged me $3 more
author: Saige A.

description:
Most Chinese restaurants on Taravel are better than this.

Went here with my parents at noon on a weekday. What a bad experience. Ordered a rice dish. They were serving 99% elderly here, at $4 a plate for them. My parents got theirs in 2 minutes. I got mine in 30 minutes. Asked the waitress to check on my dish, and she responds from 20 feet away, "It's coming, it's coming." Waited a bit longer and told her I'd like the bill, cancel my order. She said it's already out. It only arrives 10 minutes after that.

If you enjoy waiting forever, where everyone around you get their food before you (even the ones that are seated after you), and waitresses give you the run around, this place is for you.
author: Chris H.

description: This is a very nice restaurant, the service is nice and there is this one guy that works here always cheerful and making sure that when i go here i get good service and even remembers my name. I think his name is Simon, Anyways if u are looking for a good after work dinner place this is it:)
author: Rv Andrew V.

description: This is a busy section of town and should always be busy.  Not!  Depending on what you order, its lack of service and lack of meat on the food.  I've been here many times and depending on the server, its kind of bad for the money you spend on per item that there's such bad service.   One time the waiter gave my food to a different table and the customer never said it was the wrong food and ate my food.  Its a seniors hang out because it serves a special discount meal. It was not busy and waiter never bother to check on me and ask where's my food.  I have to ask where's my food.  My tea was never fill as many time that I was here.  Which is worse Ming Kee or here?  Ming Kee have better price and menu.  HK style cafe food should be like Bakery Cafe on Noriega, lots of sauce.  They are stingy on sauce.
author: Mar H.

description:
+/- THE FOOD
The food is pretty decent Hong Kong style cafe food. A group of 5 of us had preserved egg and meat porridge, soy sauce pan-fried noodles, Hong Kong style rice noodle rolls, Chinese donut, salt and pepper chicken wings, baked clam spaghetti, and 2 puff pastry soups. The noodles and porridge were a great combo and provided a nice balance between bland and salty. The salt and pepper chicken wings were perfectly juicy and had a nice crispy texture to it. The rice noodle rolls had the classic peanut butter, hoisin sauce, and srircha sauce to it. the puff pastry soups were good but took WAY too long to come out. It came out at the end of the meal when everyone was done eating already. Next time, I would probably opt for the soups without puff pastry, especially since they're an additional $2.50 for puff pastry.
author: Cindy C.

description:
This is our second time here.  Last time, we docked here after a very long plane ride and we were exhausted.   The service at 10 pm was pleasant and the soup and braised gourd dish that we ordered filled our tummies in a good way.  

We were very impressed at how clean and fresh everything tasted.  We had flown to HK last year and learned that fresh, lightly seasoned food was the Hong Kong way.  Eating was an elevated art form in this small port city.  S&E deserves high ratings for being true to its roots.  The bathroom was also very clean.  

We're trying again on a Sunday.  Hopefully, our good memories will be maintained.
author: Emma R.

description:
Came here for a quick bite, and it was pretty good. Boyfriend had the Hong Kong style baked chicken rice, the chicken was crispy on the outside and soft inside. I had the cream corn soup with puff pastry and it was delicious. The HK milk tea had just about the right milk and tea portion, we ordered 2 more to go. 
Overall a pretty chill place to eat, but had to take a star off for cleanliness. On some of the plates (one of them was underneath my soup bowl), I could see black specs.
author: Grace L.

description: Cozy little place for classic HK/Chinese cafe style food. I like the clam chowder with the flaky bread top thing. Love the baked beef tongue + spagett with red sauce. Tried the escargots my last visit and those were surprisingly good: very tender, not chewy at all. I've had the ribeye steak and the eel here, which were both delicious. Best part is they're open late!
author: Garrett C.

description:
I order take-out from this place pretty often. I have only had a few dishes here, but the ones I always go to now are the Curry Beef Stew over rice and the Macau-style chicken over rice (with white sauce).

If I sit down to eat, I will occasionally order the rib-eye. For the price, you can't beat it. 

My only complaint is I wish the rice was a bit higher quality.
author: Sihoon Y.

description: This place is ridiculous. The owner really cares about those CHAPMSS customers, who apparently are welfare cheaters because they are wearing luxury jewelries and driving luxury cars. Other regular paying customers have to wait for a long time to get to see their dishes coming. I have been waiting for more than half an hour for a simple rice dish and not yet get anything to eat.
author: hudson w.

description:
Very good Chow Fun. Chicken wings a little too greasy. Soup good but too much salt.

Please should be cleaner. The horrible Norman Yee (bad political) sign blocking the door is very bad. No to this sign, no to Norman/lazy incumbent, no to this restaurant from all of us who had dinner there.
author: John G.

description: The food is pretty good. I order salt and pepper chicken wings and fried fish balls. Those are really good. I definitely will return here. Hope I can try some good new stuff.
author: Annie Z.

description:
One of my favorite places to go. I come here about once a week or so. I always like to get steak or lamb chops =P but I enjoy the fact that I can also come here for some good chow fun. Normally I don't like gravy chow fun because I never get enough gravy but this place gives you plenty! They also have really good fish. I don't really like fish but the fillets are good. 

Stuff you should try, 
Steak (obviously) comes with spaghetti or rice - the pasta is surprisingly good and well flavored
Chicken wings!
Salmon Fried Rice - one of my favs
Gravy Chow Fun
author: Cheryl C.

description:
For some unknown reason, I'm pretty jazzed about this place, despite the rating. It's definitely not the best but it will become our new go-to lunch place after church on Sundays. ESPECIALLY during the football season hehe

Customer service is sucky and pretty much non-existent. The lady that took our older asked us each 4 times what we wanted. She kept getting it wrong! It literally made me not want to order anything else...

Not sure if this is just me but when I opened the menu, I thought everything was a little overpriced. But I got the Fish Balls and Sausage Macaroni Soup. It was alright. I mean you can make it at home. The bowl was huge! It was definitely filling.

The best part was the football game that was playing on the TV on the wall. And it's great for groups. It'll be our new ABC.
author: Athena C.

description:
Service was great. Fast and responsive.

Food is could be better but good enough for me.

I ordered salmon salad, XO Chinese Changfun 

Both are delicious but my friend who ordered beef egg over rice, the rice is a little hard.
author: Mack A.

description:
Came here for a quick hk food lunch.  The restaurant is spacious and clean, friendly staff.  Food is hit and miss. Ordered both the hk style pork chop with tomato sauce over rice, and a french style oxtail.  The hk pork chop was really bland and had zero flavor.  They should have fried the pork chop, but it was griled and dry.  The tomato sauce was ehhh, no flavor at all, it tasted like watered down tomato sauce from a can.  The bed of fried rice on the bottom was also really bad.

On a brighter side, the french style oxtail was delicious, a perfectly made tomato based sauce, rich and satisfying.  My only complaint is that there wasnt that much oxtail meat, the dish is a little pricey, but at least it was satisfying.

Like most asian places, some items are good, and some items are bad.  I just wish they could make all their food taste good consistently.
author: Terence N.

description:
My boyfriend got the wonton soup and said it was pretty good, but the service here is horrible. It took a long time for someone to take our order and on top of that my food took 35+ minutes to come out. I definitely wouldn't come back because there are way better options in the area. 

ALSO right when I got my food I found an ant on the plate. Okay den..
author: Lindsey E.

description:
The most expensive Hk style cafe in sunset district or San Francisco I believe ..  Curry beef stew over rice $14 or $15 forgot !!
But come on, you charge everything expensive than other place, but the taste is worst than other place.  
Plus you don't have any fancy interior .. Why everything expensive than other cafe over $2-$5 different 

SMH
author: Kevin K.

description:
Pros - cheap, tables for a small party, conveniently located
Cons - long wait for food, rice dishes are heavy on rice and skimpy on meat/veggies.

An hour wait for the food. AN HOUR!
Is this acceptable? No, never. 
Did they apologize or tried to recompense us for the wait? No.
I'm still a little irked by the whole experience.

Anyways, the food was alright. It wasn't anything special. I ordered Mongolian beef, my go-to safe dish, and it was decent. I felt that the sauce to meat ratio could be adjusted but that's my own personal preference in taste.

As for my friends, their rice to meat/veggies ratio was severely out of whack. It seriously seemed like they were trying to cut the cost by filling the plate with rice rather than meat and vegetables. Pretty disappointing. 

After today, I'm sad to say, S&E is now on my list of "never again" restaurants.
author: Wing C.

description: This place is open late so it was awesome to be able to walk in and order fish ball egg noodle soup, a kind of comfort food for me. The portions are really big, so I ended taking half home and finishing it the next day, but it's about as good as this kind of soup will get. So comforting and fills my body with warmth!
author: Larissa L.

description:
Came on a weekday around 11am, pretty empty. half hour later, FULL OF SENIORS surrounding our table. We were like, wtf is going on? a senior party or something? We then figured out that they provide senior lunch for those senior with lunch tickets.
Literally, besides the staff and us, whoever sat in there were ASIAN SENIORS who were talking in loud Taishanese! I feel like, am i going to the wrong place? or this is a lunch place for seniors gathering?
Food came in a medium portion, price is kinda expensive comparing to the food.
Never coming back at lunch time again... no more eating with old strangers.. GOSH!
maybe at night will be better.
author: Kalum Z.

description: Whenever we are craving hongkong food, we stop by here because it is nearby. Their food is really not bad and their service is good. The employees are nice and friendly. I like that they give you bread and also a soup when you go. My favorite dish here is the porkchop over spaghetti. Some places serve the pork chop really hard and dry but S&E's pork chop is very juicy. Their chicken wings are also really good. Sometimes we buy food here and take half of it home as another meal because their portion sizes are good.
author: Mike H.

description:
Another Hong Kong Style Chinese place for me to see how they stack up against other places. My go to dish is always Pork chop over rice with tomato sauce. This was the very first dish I had when I tried Hong Kong style Chinese food so it's only fitting I use that as my base of comparison.

The pork chop was seasoned adequately but felt it was too dry. It came pre-sliced which was disappointing since it deprived me of the joy of making the first cut. That aside, I found the tomato sauce to be on the saltier side and lacked the balance I have found in other versions. As for the pork, it had a grainy quality to it as I chewed.

The house special curry beef had a decent back of the throat kick and the meat was tender. I enjoyed the consistency but will admit it's not like most Chinese curries that I have tried. My sister in law actually had to send a dish back because the sauce, cream based, tasted sour. They said that the sauce was finished with lemon juice which is why it was on the sour side. They brought back her dish without lemon juice and it was fine. 

I do like the fact that they provide soup, drink and dessert with your meal! 

Overall Thoughts

Unfortunately, the pork chop was a bust
author: Eddie W.

description:
Food:
Typical HK Cafe style, with HUGE portions. Most of the dishes were ordered were very good. My parents each ordered a version of their pork chops - the grilled version was very tender. The baked version was actually breaded and fried? Not sure if this was delivered correctly, but it was still nice and juicy. I ordered my fave ox tongue over spaghetti. It was on point. The tongue had been prepped nicely. It was SUPER tender and very delicious. Not fatty or tough at all! My brother ordered a grilled pork chop with fried egg. The egg is sunny side up, just be forewarned.

Each meal came with an appetizer of butternut squash soup and dinner rolls. The soup was okay, but we sat right next to the room where they prepped it....straight out of the microwave. It also came with your choice of hot milk tea or hot coffee. Milk tea had condensed milk already added and maybe it was a cover up of something else, but my parents and I all had a stomach ache later in the night, most likely from the milk tea...eep! Dessert was included as well, your choice of yam soup or jello.

Service:
Could definitely use some work, we stood at the entry way for a good 10 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. I understand that no tables were free, but at least acknowledge your patrons! And the waitress definitely needs to understand the menu, my parents wanted to know the difference between HK style and Macau style to which she said "I don't know, that's a mistake on the menu" - what? An older guy walked over and explained the HK style is grilled while the Macau style is baked. 

Also...employees need defined roles. All the waitresses here not only take orders and deliver dishes, but they also pick up finished dishes and wipe down tables....and I'm certain they don't wash their hands between the clean/dirty tasks. Gross.

I'd consider coming again, I'd just pass up the milk tea next time.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
If you want cheap, mediocre, greasy Chinese food, and willing to wait 35 minutes between dishes, while dealings with grumpy waiters offending upset customers, this place has it all.  

I have no idea why this place gets over 3 stars.   Many tables around us are missing orders.  While we waited, we could see people waiting over 30 minutes for missing dishes at the take out counter.  

What a dump!  Congratulations you are the worst 1-star review I have ever given.  

Tip: stay away!
author: Ben W.

description: I was pretty excited for this place because I was really craving some Asian food. However, I can't say I was super satisfied with what I got. I ordered the minced pork rice with a raw egg because in the photo there was a pretty raw egg in the middle (and I LOVE eggs). When I received the dish, I didn't see any egg. Only after mixing it all up did I realize the egg was stuffed at the bottom but now I lost it because I already mixed up my dish. Also, the dish was incredibly salty. I will have to say they give big portions so its worth the money especially since everything in the city is so darn expensive. We also ordered the fish balls, which were pretty decent. I got a shrimp and egg fried rice to go. It was pretty good except there was way more rice than actual shrimp, egg, and seafood. They give you honey lemon tea for starters and taro soup for dessert. Overall, the food was mediocre, but if you're in the mood for cheap large portions of Asain food then I would say come here.
author: Alice Y.

description:
Ever since they switched owners, the place is definitely not as good and the Yelp check in offer no longer works :/ 

I had the minced beef with egg rice and it was below average and tasted chunky. My dad had the baked pork chop rice which was better but it was strange that the baked dish was way faster than my rice plate. 

Waitresses and waiters are very sweet but definitely amateur at serving food. As one of the waitresses placed a bowl of soup on the table, she spilled some of it into my milk tea and had to replace it.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
I'm sure there's many pros and cons to this place so thus, why it merely gets 3 stars.

Pros:
- Free wifi
- Open early and late
- Cheap and big portions
- Most orders come with milk tea or coffee, soup, and bread (but it wasn't even that great)

Cons:
- Cash only
- Service could be improved
- Food is just mediocre 
- Trying to find parking sorta sucks
- Not enough tables

***From reading other reviews, I guess the tomato based sauce wasn't very good. My experience with the white based sauce was very creamy and delicious.
author: Fiona L.

description:
We went to S&E Cafe in SF for a late dinner. It was around 11:30pm when we got there and this place did have few tables. We were promptly served with water and menu.

Macau Style Pork Chop Portuguese Sauce with Spaghetti - pork chop was amazing! It was crispy, tender, and juicy. I was rather impressed, most of the Asian places use baking soda or powder mandarin the pork chop to the point there are no more texture! This place was perfect! Spaghetti was al-dente! I wish they could throw in couple broccolis :P

Clam Vermicelli Noodle Soup (I forgot the name) - clam was pretty good, soup base was good, light and refreshing.

I couldn't mind go back for their pork chop :)
author: Sandi C.

description: Stay away!! This restaurant is filthy.  I was invited to a private party at S&E. They have this private room upstairs. It's like a lounge room at end of the this hallway where there are stairs access to the kitchen and up to a patio where people would smoke. The place is  smelly and the back access stairs are greasy, sorry and full of cigarette butts. You can find employees squatting in front of the business smoking away ignoring the no smoking sign.
author: Roadrunner G.

description:
This little place has a good menu and very friendly staff. The Mongolian chicken rice plate is delicious. 

The place itself is strangely decorated and not particularly inviting but you won't spend too much time there, because they're quick. 

When you order you are brought a broth-type soup: skip it. But other than that, I would say to check this place out if you want authentic Chinese.
author: Brittney P.

description:
Service was better on our subsequent visit. 

We had HK Chicken with cream (white) gravy. Thought it was good. Chicken was tasty and gravy was good. It had spaghetti under the baked chicken pieces. The size of the portion was big too. (4 stars).

The TV's were tuned to a station with an exercise and weight loss program. Thought that was kind of odd to have in a restaurant for the diners to watch. But it was in Chinese, so I guess that made it all right.

Takes Mastercard and Visa.
author: Steven G.

description:
We've been coming here for years and we keep coming back regularly. Definitely highly recommended!
The food is always fresh and delicious. The service is very nice.
I don't usually take time to write reviews but i was shocked to see these 1 star ratings. We've been here so many times. This is a very nice and friendly restaurant and we've never had an unpleasant experience. If you give it a try you won't be disappointed!
author: Nicole A.

description: We came here to get something quick and warm. I had the beef stew won ton mein and I enjoyed it. It's a good place to get something quick or if where you go doesn't matter. It's almost like any Chinese cafe kinda deal. Service wasn't bad either
author: Maggie W.

description:
My friend and I walked in on Thursday around 3:30pm and there were plenty of seats available. The sweet waitress resembles my mom, or any sweet Asian mom for that much haha. After I received my food, I hardly received any more attention from her after since her friend stopped by as well and dined in. It was slightly difficult trying to get the check too since she was very involved with her conversation with her friend.

Onto the food, I love myself some Tomato/ Ketchup Chicken Steak with Spaghetti. But there's definitely better - if you're looking for what I love, head to T-28 or Cafe Bakery. The ketchup/tomato sauce was watered down and the spaghetti was and looked more like lo-mein or even chow mein, nothing like actual italian spaghetti.

Won't be back and wouldn't recommend to friends.
author: Yeanne L.

description:
If you come here around 5, there's practically no one. So service is decent. 

Since the change of ownership, there have also been changes in the menus. Depending on what dish you get, you may also get complimentary soup and dessert (both varies). I've been coming here for a while and the things I get are the beef strips, spaghetti, pork katsu, and chicken pineapple fried rice. This time I ordered the beef strips with white sauce and it was pretty good. Except the sauce didn't have much taste on its own. It looks big but it's actually not that much. This dish is pricey, $13.50 but the other food I listed are under $10 I believe.
author: Adrienne S.

description:
Look MA...another place for LATE NIGHT DRUNK EATS!

Since I can't go out to eat for the next 2.5 weeks, I figure I catch up on my Yelp reviews... 

On Thursday, January 13th, after attending the Yelp Holiday Hangover Party, my friends and I came to S&E Cafe at around 10 PM for some buzzed eats (closes @ 2 AM on weeknights and 4:30 AM on weekends). It was busy but there were still some open tables so we were promptly seated.

As many Yelper's have mentioned S&E Café IS a step up from D&A Café (my fav HK cafe) and ABC. Everything is pretty clean including the bathrooms so you don't have to worry about being in contact with yucky germs like the bathrooms of the aforementioned HK cafes.

F O O D:
*FRIED CHICKEN WINGS (midsections): OK.

WINGS ARE MY ADDICTION so much so that I've had to designate a DWS (Designated Wing Stopper) on the weekends just so I can keep my paws off of them when I'm drunk. It wasn't the weekend and there was no DSW, so of course I had to take advantage of this opportunity. :X

The 6 moderately sized wings are fried w/o batter so it wasn't as crispy as I would have liked it. The meat was tender but not moist and lacked seasoning. It was accompanied by bottled thai chili sauce which added some sweetness, tang, and spiciness but was too syrupy. 

If you like Chicken Wings, definitely pay a visit to D&A for their Ginormous Salt & Pepper Wings, they're BOMB!

*HK BAKED PORK CHOP w/ Rice (comes with soup and dinner roll):
-Veggie Soup: EHHH, the soup tasted like it was made from bouillon and then watered down b/c it was bland and you can see a ring of orange color on the edges of the bowl. The only veggies were soggy onions and parsley.

-Dinner Roll: GOOD! The dinner roll is similar to a Pan de Sal that's lightly brushed with butter on top for that shiny brown sheen color. The rolls come out warm out of the oven and is pillowy soft, delicate and very fluffy. 

-HK Baked Pork Chop w/ Rice: MEH!

It took about 20 minutes for my order to come and when it did, I swear my pork chop tasted like chicken. I even had my friends taste it and they thought it was chicken also. I asked the waitress and she was convinced it was pork and even had the chef come out to confirm it. I was buzzed NOT drunk but ummm, ok...

The "pork" had a very soft texture and was slathered with a runny tomato sauce which tasted like watered down ketchup; very bland and lacked a savory sweet tang. It was lightly topped with cheese, but not enough to flavor the dish. It was very unappetizing to say the least. Normally when I'm buzzed, I can polish off my food with no problem; this time I could only stomach myself to eat half of my order.

S E RV I C E:
Although the food took some time to come out, our waitress was very friendly and nice. Unlike some other HK Cafes, it was easy to get the attention of the wait staff when we wanted something and they did it w/o us having to ask multiple times or getting an attitude. 

2 Stars for the food and 1 Star for the friendly customer service which is a rarity in Asian restaurants. 

The search continues for MOUTH-WATERING drunk eats...

P.S. - CC's Accepted
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I would probably have only given S&E Cafe 2 stars but I respect them for the insane amount of hours that they are open and their presentation and cleanliness given how many normal Chinese cafes look.

Service is expected that of any Chinese restaurant so it's nothing worth noting to be honest.

Food, itself, was just ok. I didn't think it was anything particularly satiated but if I can come in at 1AM and you'll still make me some jook. It's good enough in my book.

If anything else in the area is open, just go somewhere else. Otherwise, S&E boasts a large variety of food. They seem clean enough and at 1AM, your choices start to dwindle a bit.
author: Winè C.

description: I've been coming here for many years even after they changed owners and menus a few times. There Is never a mistake with my orders. But tonight. I ordered two baked HK style spaghetti with meat sauce to go. When I got home, I got one with the meat sauce and this other one with an orange sauce that was not sour like how it is usually. There must have been a mixed up when they were pouring the sauce.... The one I got just tasted like a garlic orange sauce. Makes me want to just pour some ketchup into it so it can be sour. It just tastes like it belonged with another type of dish... They shouldn't make two sauces so similar in ingredients and color. There will bound to be a mixed up.....
author: Cori N.

description:
This place serves your standard HK/Chinese cafe food, tossed noodle, chow fun, baked spaghetti etc. nothing too special here though. 
This place is best suited for getting fed while on a budget OR getting fed when you're drunk as Fuh after the club. 
The service is also what you would expect of a HK cafe if you know what I mean. 
You better brush up on you canto or you kind of can't order and when I showed the waitress the check-in deal to get a free Honey Lemon Tea she looked at me like I asked her for her first born son, so don't bother!
Overall its not a bad place, you just have to go at the right time/ in the right state of mind.
author: Antonio W.

description:
Had the #95 braised tofu. Omg!!! Awesome!  

The sauce and bokchoi was tasty fresh and made to perfection. Some of the best I'm had of tofu dishes. 

Also had mango shake. It's thin and more like a milk drink.
author: Esther F.

description: Oh my gosh Becky, the noodles weren't even cooked all the way. Still crunchy hard...  Good thing I ordered another entrée. I would not recommend this place to anyone...
author: Irwin S.

description: Wow! These people lie! I ordered the Portuguese sauce with shrimp and scallop spaghetti. I got my order and it was different from what I had I'm the past. The portuguese sauce used to have a orange red color to it and it had a lot of flavor.  I showed the waitress a photo from yelp what it's supposed to be like. She said to me the reflection from the lights is making the sauce that color. What??? If you look at my photo does it look red? NO! I found out they changed owners and they probably have new chefs. Also noticed NO free bread and milk tea anymore with my meal!! Wtf! No bueno for lying and the food went downhill.
author: Karen T.

description:
Hum, what shall I say about the first restaurant delivery that pissed me off enough to write my first ever review on the internet?

Let's be fair, your food is alright, for the most part it's what I expect for the price. 

But. 
     Your.
             Delivery.
                          Person.............................................................. rude beyond reproach.

First of all refusing to deliver to a person's door in an apartment building.... is a half-assed delivery at best. To mutter under your breath audibly in Cantonese insults during the call is not appropriate either. 

It shouldn't matter if I speak Chinese or not (I do, thus the rage), but to go outright and call someone you deliver to a "cripple", *somehow* angered me enough to confront him about his F*cking behavior that night.  

If you want mediocre food at a relatively low price and are actively looking for a unbelievably bad, rude, overall sh*tty delivery experience, I suppose you can give them a call.
author: Justin L.

description:
Great service! Really good baked dishes. I always get the Macau style cutlet with white sauce and rice. And the XO turnip cake is so tasty

Big portions and what you'd expect from a HK style cafe (not cafe in the American sense, more like a diner) 

Late hours too! 

Awesome
author: Jeff L.

description:
Precisely what it is. A chinese cafe open late and YES, i am a fan! The portions are relatively large, the servers were super courteous, open late and decent food! What more can you ask for?? Not to mention you get a free soda check in deal?! Holy cow, I will come back for my drunken late night munchies!! S&E cafe, you will soon see me on a regular basis :)

TIPS:
So far I've ordered the beef chow fun (not as much beef as I would have liked) but the noodles didn't seem to greasy - OKAY
Pan fried noodles with chicken and veggies (super good! They loaded up on so much bok choy and I LOVED IT! - must order next time!!
author: Anh Thu P.

description: Bad customer service had to seat our self and que the server that we were here. The server doesn't speak English so if u speak Chinese that's the only way they will get your order correct if not will charge you extra on how u want your eggs cooked. Which they don't inform you before they charge your. Overall this place sucks unless you speak their language to be better understood
author: Janie S.

description: Used cheap ingredients, way different than we usually order in the past, the party next to us has complain too, will not come again.
author: Christopher W.

description: Average food quality and average favor. The only place open until midnight. You get a large portion for the dish
author: Nancy H.

description: My go-to spot for late night Chinese food! It's just slightly more expensive than nearby alternatives like Smile Cafe or ABC Cafe, but the quality of the food is significantly better. Service is good, they're open late-not sure what more I could ask for.
author: Nelson D.

description:
Disappointing! I used to be a regular customer before change of ownership. 

Under new ownership, price is up but not the services. Take so long for foods to come. We ordered 2 entrees and 1 fried rice to go at the same time. After 30 min, guess what?! The fried rice came first and the waitress handed us the bill !!! 

My suggestion to the staff: pay attention to your customers

My suggestion to the owner: don't set up so many tables if your crew can't serve that many. I don't come pay to waste my time!
author: Christy C.

description:
This place has some delicious food, but their service and attitude can use some major improvement. Every once in awhile I get a hankering for their delicious crispy chicken wings and a sandwich but every time I break down and order delivery I am left a bit disappointed with how I am treated as a customer. I have ordered delivery from them about 10 times and this is what I have noticed:

First, if you don't like mayonnaise (or are allergic!) don't get any of the sandwiches. They will not listen if you request no mayonnaise. One time we put "no mayonnaise on the sandwiches, please!" FIVE DIFFERENT TIMES in various places when we made the order online. In turn, they slathered that mayonnaise on perhaps a bit more than usual. Many of our dinners have been ruined because of this. 

Second, their fries are usually soggy and under cooked. Some people like that, and I have no qualms with shoving them in the oven for a short while but this defeats the purpose of "ordering out" in my opinion

Third, the delivery person will without fail call you and make you come out to the street to get your food. Even with very specific instructions and a house that is not difficult to see from the street, they usually can't even park their car in front of my house and I have to wander the street looking for them. And they are often rude and unpleasant to interact with.
author: liz c.

description:
This place actually has been here forever. I used to live near Golden Gate Park while I was in highschool and I actually did come pretty frequent back then. Somhow after I moved closer to it and I've stopped visiting until recently at my friend's recommendation.

It opens till pretty late and it has a rather large selection of Chinese food and Chinese style American food. 

I've tried their steak spaghetti before and it was pretty yummy. My last few visits were pretty late. Since I don't want to gain too much weight from late night munching, I consistently ordered their Chinese fishball noodle soup. I can't complain much about it nor do I have much good things to say; it's pretty standard normal quality that you can get from most Chinese places in the city. 

Overall, I'd say 3 stars for the food + 1 star for the conveniently long hours they serve.
author: Victor K.

description: I ate here for a late night dinner. The waitress was well rounded. She did a great job! The food was so good. I ordered a baked spaghetti with pork chop. It was worth getting because it was only 10 dollars for a large serving. I recommend this place to anyone who is craving Chinese food
author: Bailey C.

description:
I came here about twice in my lifetime. Both times, I had no problem with the service and it's great to know that they have wifi ! My biggest concern here is the oil level with the food. A lot of HK style food tends to have a lot of oil and I have had my fair share of HK food experiences, but not quite like this. Some of the dishes I had here were extremely oily, like the spaghetti and the fish and vegetables. Oh my goodness, the vegetables. When you get the vegetables, it's not just boiled, but rather coated with a few layers of oil. You will know when you get a puddle of oil after you finish your meal. 

I would only come here if I am totally desperate. In terms of price, it is a little bit pricer than I expected from a HK style place. The atmosphere of the restaurant is great, but the food tends to be too oily.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
I honestly don't know what HK style food is, but if this place is at all representative of that cuisine, I think I like it. 

My go-to item is the HK Style Porkchop with rice and Portuguese sauce. It's just a good hearty meal. Their white sauce is good too. 
I usually end up coming here around 10pm, when I finish work late and most dinner places are closed. Seems like they're open till 2am on most nights! It's one of the very few restaurants in the Sunset open so late. I expected this place to be constantly packed with SF State students considering the late hours and location, but that isn't the case. It's a good thing. Heh.

My one gripe about this place is that a lot of times it seems like they're understaffed. When this place gets anywhere near full, expect your food to take about 30minutes. There was one meal when it was just me and the gf, and the dinner took close to 2 hours. They brought out the wrong item to us twice after 20min waits each time, and after the second time we gave up and ate it.  Now it would have been fine if we were having an amazing conversation and all, but we were just trying to grab a quick dinner. There was only one server working and one other girl that was half working? I say half working because she wasn't dressed in uniform, she had no idea about anything on the menu, and she was bussing tables two plates at a time. The story we came up with was that half worker girl was originally there to eat, but her waitress friend begged her to help because two servers called in sick, and half worker girl was there reluctantly kinda working but not. 

Anyways, I like the food here. I've been back several times even after that 2 hour long meal, so they must be doing something right.
author: TJ Y.

description:
Think D&A Cafe, but pricier.

A couple of friends and I came here after midnight for some fourth meal munchies. It does resemble the minor details of D&A and other relatable restaurants, like the mounted flat-screens, decor, and menu design (I thought it was funny how their menu cover is an exact picture of their restaurant entrance). 

Ox Tail Special - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=-eeRF2DpGHk-awIb036M3w&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
When I order Ox Tail anywhere, I think of Chinatown's New Lun Ting Cafe (aka Porkchop House) and wonder if it could top their Ox Tail Curry. That answer today is, no. S&E does serve up hefty portions, but it just wasn't too great. The Ox Tail was tender but instead of a curry base, it was cooked with a tomato sauce which gave it a sour taste and it just wasn't what I wanted when I'm hitting my fourth meal. I even had to shake the pepper a few times to give it a little kick. 

The cost for a dish at S&E in comparison to your typical Chinese restaurant is a tad more expensive. Though each order does come with complimentary soup of the day, dinner roll, and a drink, it's still a little staggering to pay $14-15 for some average Chinese food (especially if your drunk!). On the other hand, S&E is definitely cleaner and the service is super nice, despite pass peak hours, all that coming from a Chinese restaurant is saying a lot.
author: Albert L.

description:
my boyfriend and I were hungry and wanted cheap food so we came here cause we've never had it before. the prices are all very reasonable. service is good, all the workers were very nice and polite. 

we ordered the Hong Kong style rolled rice noodles which were very good. it was sweet and peanuty because there's a peanut sauce on it. we also got the salt & pepper chicken wings which had the right amounts of seasoning & the perfect amount of fry. and we also got an order of oxtail tongue with mushrooms and Portuguese sauce over spaghetti noodles. the sauce was sweet and creamy. 

everything we ordered was delicious and we would actually come back here a lot and try other things off the menu, which is really good because we're both extremely picky about where we eat.
author: Janey H.

description:
I would order again:
Singapore noodles
any of the fried rice
porridge
won ton noodle soup

I would pass on:
Avocado milkshake
Noodles with Shrimp and Egg

It's a good place for groups at night time.
author: Derek M.

description:
Thanks again Yelp for helping me find a good, affordable dinner spot near my friend's house. My friends and I needed to fuel up before going out. I liked their set menus because they add a dinner roll, rice or pasta and coffee or tea. I have not had good HK cafe style food since moving away from LA almost 6 years ago... yessh I am getting old. Anyway, their grilled pork chop with black pepper sauce (by request) was very good. Meat was moist, flavorful and just the right amount of grilled texture on the outside. What surprised me was the pasta. It looked like plain pasta but once the fork was in my mouth there was an explosion of garlic goodness gustatory pleasure. Now i need a cigarette! Yes, it was that good! The break up the meat and starches, they added steam veggies also marinated in garlicky goodness. I ordered the hot milk tea, which was perfect. 

Pricing for dinner is VERY reasonable, and the service is prompt, quick and friendly. I also appreciated their decor with the kitschy Chef Boyardee-like figurines holding the salt and pepper shakers. They even provided green jello drizzled with a bit of condensed milk on it, if you are into it. 

I shall return S&E Cafe....
author: Thomas L.

description: We got here around 11pm on a Saturday night. Wasn't too busy and we sat down immediately. Service was fair. Food came in a decent amount of Time. The food looked great. I had came here previously many years ago, and was rather pleased with their baked spaghetti; so I wanTed to try it again. It was defenitely what it wasn't. It was sweet and the meat balls were the frozen ones u can buy from Costco. It tasted like it was cooked with the juices and oil from the previous dish before it. Won't come back.
author: Jill P.

description: My second time eating here occurred on a Friday night.  I ordered the pork cutlet with spaghetti and salt and pepper chicken wings.  The food was average.  The chicken wings was on the salty side.  The portion of the pork cutlet with spaghetti was huge and their price was on the higher side.  Complimentary soup was served when I ate there for the first time during lunch several month ago.  Maybe, their complimentary soup is currently only to be served to their regular customers.
author: Steve T.

description: Last time I was there ordered a Ma Po Tofu and it didn't taste spicy enough. Or maybe because I love spicy food so much lol. The rest were just fine with a fair price in my opinion. My family loves to go there often for meals and the only thing that bothers us every time is finding a parking spot due to the location.
author: Keith Z.

description:
Like all the other Cafes that I have been to like Go Go Cafe, D & A  Cafe, Dennys Cafe, Cafe Bakery & Restaurant,  Broadway Bistro Cafe... Those Cafes that I have been to sort of reminds of the ones that I have just mentioned..Now that, I have eaten at the S & E Cafe for lunch for the first time this place isnt that bad at all the service of the food which I have ordered from the Waitress came pretty fast!!!
The Spaghetti W/ Meat Sauce And Meat Ball which I have ordered looked very good once I ate it...  I sort of like this place and the bathrooms that they got here at S & E Cafe  is pretty clean!!!
author: William B.

description:
4 words: Never again! & ZERO STARS

My first experience was pretty crappy. I thought it was because we arrived @10PM. 

Second experience @7PM, still crappy. Service was still slow. Food was still mediocre. End of story.

You're better off eating at Cafe Bakery especially since they have daily deals on their baked meals.
author: Winn D.

description: Prolly the best of the Taraval St HK style cafes, (cha chang ten.) in terms of portion size, price, quality and customer service, as every table full at dinner time attests to. Feeling the pressure from newcomer Smile House Cafe down the street, and T-28 further down, these folks, always consistently good through the years, have decided to really "ramp it up" and COMPETE, (a good sign, I'm always impressed when I see businesses doing that. It means they are smart, are paying attention, and value their customer base's loyalty.) So in the competitive environment of the Taraval St HK Cafes, S&E has made a conscious decision to compete.....and the result is that they WIN, hands down! Just finished their spectacular "Portuguese Chicken" with spaghetti. Giant sized and Yum-O!! Great value and definitely worth the money. Be hungry when you order this, and you will be full, guaranteed! POSTSCRIPT: Except for offering Winnie and I "jello" for the complimentary dessert (offered to all customers at the end of their dinner meal,) while offering all Chinese customers "sweet potato dessert," the dinner was perfect. (Yo! Ma! Do I look like "jello" to you? Dang dawg, why you wanna be so prejudice? Lol. Haha. Jk. But n e way, Winnie, overhearing them offer that to all the Chinese tables around us, and not the "jello," told the waitress that we would prefer the sweet potato one, and she did bring it to us.) Point being, they do offer dessert to everyone! (unlike some Cantonese restaurants that offer it only to their Chinese customers, something I have experienced countless times both here in SF and in the East Bay, see my review for "Kirin.") even if they do their version of "racial profiling," when they do. Haha. All in all though, a good place to go for a quick, good, filling, casual dinner after work. But man, that dang Portuguese chicken, can't get my mind offa that....:)
author: George F.

description: Cantonese food that's open until 2 am! Came here with a few of my church friends after we went to Academy of Sciences Nightlife on Thursday. As an Asian restaurant, it was good and fairly clean. Their customer service is... a bit lacking. In one particular incidence, we waved over a waitress to take our order and instructed her to start at the other end of the table. She waved to us and walked away... maybe it was miscommunicated on our end? Or maybe I was just tired and a bit cranky. Anyways, I'll be back if I ever have the chance.
author: Stacey W.

description: Great place to come for a late dinner.  Always been a good experience each time I come.  Though there was one time I ordered the salmon avocado sandwich and only later noticed there wasn't any avocado.  Other than that, I've had no problems there.  Food is good, inexpensive, and comes in big portions.  The baked pork chop with spaghetti in Portuguese sauce seems to be popular, and I can vouch for that.  Service is very good.  They are attentive and courteous.  The waitresses are very sweet.  The dude with the glasses, who appears to be the manager or something of the sort, is always energetic and hospitable.  This place meets all my needs of a good restaurant. :)
author: Nelson W.

description:
Meh... 

The food is okay. I ordered the pork chop over spaghetti with their ketchup sauce. I did know they would actually use ketchup. I thought it was what they called their red tomato sauce. I ordered the same dish during another visit and I remember it being 10 times better. Maybe they changed management... The service is horrible. The older man that was waiting the tables was too busy staring at the live seafood to seat us. And when we finally got seated and ordered... My party who arrived before a couple of other tables did not get anything while they got soup before their entree. 

Never stepping foot in this restaurant again.
author: Michelle F.

description: This is a pretty decent cafe and the portions are really big and are definitely worth the price. However the majority of the dishes are on the blander side and need a little more flavor and seasoning. The service was very fast and easy to get their attention, and cafe is very clean and modern looking.
author: Tina W.

description: Was outside checking out the menu at night and decided to go in, then saw a mouse went inside at the same time. Of course, went to the closest similar place immediately instead.
author: Kevin W.

description:
First learned about this place when I worked night shifts at a supermarket. Now, this one of my favorite Chinese cafes around San Francisco. Opened until 2AM, this is a favorite spot for late nights looking to grab a fourth meal or stop by after karaoke across the street.

The baked plates here are a great deal for those of you looking for an appetizer, entree and dessert all around ten bucks. Almost all of the baked dishes comes with a bit of toasted coconut on top which caught me off guard the first time I came here, but it adds a nice sweetness. Another then that, I don't really care for it.

The cleanliness of this restaurant is actually quite astounding compared to other Hong Kong cafe I've been to. The hardwood floor looks immaculate and no stains on the wall as they change decorations often. Only issue is their menu. The font on some of the categories could be more clear because it blends in with the background.
author: George Z.

description:
Before T28 and all the rest, this was the only other option for food around midnight except for Won ton House and ABC Cafe.

Their food has gotten worst as business has been getting better. I remember coming here for their interesting Vietnamese coffee.
author: M C.

description:
Popped in for the first time and was pleasantly surprised at how clean this place is, for a HK style cafe that is. 

I just ordered flat rice noodles with chicken and veggies and it's pretty tasty! I would have liked to see more veggies in it, there was just three pieces of Bok choy and three flimsy slices of carrots.

It was pretty slow to get my order and there was only two other tables at the time. Prices are a little more than the typical HK place but if the taste and quality is there I'm happy to pay a little more.

Will definitely be popping in another time to try some if their other food items.
author: Pauline T.

description: Love the Portuguese chicken steak with red sauce.  It is a big portion, I can never finish it but still good the next day.  The mushroom soup is also good. This place is our go to for delivery and late night dinner.
author: Cii V.

description:
They have yummy baked pork chop rice! The pork chop isn't super fatty and the sauce isn't super sweet like other HK style restaurants.

That is one of my only reasons for coming here. Ahaha.

Service here is either really good or really... not good. I've had both ends of the spectrum so I'm just gonna leave it at that.
author: Susan Y.

description: Exactly what I expected! In a good way! Open late, free wifi, decent portions on food; what else can I ask for?  I got the pork and 100 yr egg congee and my bf got the ma po tofu. Both were huge in portion and stayed true to culture. And ended off with free jello!  Overall, everything was pretty good and I will definitely come back!
author: Kathleen T.

description:
I give this place a 3 stars because the food is ok for the price and the service is decent. I had the baked pork and rice with white sauce. The pork was tender but everything completely lacked flavor. The service was just ok, although the people were really polite they did not get my order right, did not bring out the food on a timely manner, and forgot to bring out appetizers

Summing things up
1) food is decent price ( 6-10) a plate
2)service is polite but they are slow and forgetful
3) but open super late.
author: Reiko n.

description: This is my second time come to here for my dinner with my family I order a macau cutlet prok chops with pasta. I said i very like to be here for dinner . And the waitress give me to try the corn soup. That s for free. Thank her so much.
author: Tim L.

description: Had the Fish Filet & Pork Chops over spaghetti and Portuguese sauce for the first time and have to say was amazing. It was the first time I ate here thought what a Unique menu. I highly recommend the Bacon Prawns which were recommended by the nice waitress and were sooooo good. For the Soup we were served clam chowder, not the usual wonton or egg drop so it was a change and thought how different. Have to say it was good and enjoyed the soup. So if your looking for something a little different I would try this place. Can't wait to go back and try something else off the menu.
author: rudy a.

description:
This is a great place to eat, right off one of the major roadways of San Francisco on 19th Avenue and Taraval. Though this place has been around for awhile, I can say they've come a long way. I still remember their place before they remodeled it to the way it currently looks.

Besides opening late (I believe 2 AM), S & E Café foods' can definitely satisfy one's appetite quite well. In addition to being flavorful, their portions are more than average. Depending on how much you can eat, you can have some leftovers, though it may not be a complete meal; more so, a snack. What I also like is the presentation of the food. Very often I order the club sandwich. The way they cut and place their meats, lettuce, and everything good in between usually stay together after I take a bite. It's not sloppy at all.

The service here is quite good. There's one particular waiter that seems very aware of customer needs (i.e., automatically refilling tea without being asked) and always smiling when taking down your order.

Although this is a cash only place, there are plenty of ATMs around the neighborhood (and even one right next to this place). Seating capacity is slightly below average, but it is very presentable. Other than that, I always find myself frequenting this place often.
author: Henry N.

description: Used to love this place! Haven't visited for awhile, today felt very disappointed! The chicken chop with onion sauce( even without cheese) is SUPER OILY!! :(
author: Chi Yi L.

description:
I used to come here very often as a kid. Now they reconstructed the place and it just isn't the same. They have nicer decor but the prices skyrocketed to double the amount. For the amount they charge, the food quality and amount just isn't that great.

I come here for the seafood borsch with baked pastry, that's it. It's mighty expensive at $8 for a small bowl so I'm gonna look for a new place because I am the type of girl that rather have some good eats than stare at beautiful wallpaper.
author: Anna F.

description:
Why do I still go here every once in a blue moon and expect a different result?
I practically bused my own table because the waitresses were completely oblivious to everyone.
If you crave HK style food late at night, I'm sure this place hits the spot for you.
(Un)fortunately I never will have that craving, but I have a lot of friends who do.
author: Mercutio k.

description:
Good: spaghetti; any of the steaks; the Angus beef in cream sauce over rice is surprisingly good.

Okay: seafood udon noodle soup since it's bland to me; shrimp and "wet" egg over rice; pork chop (both deep fried and with grilled onions versions).

The meat combination (steak, chicken breast, sausages, pork chop) is the best deal. All the entrees come with veggies, a dinner roll and soup so you'll be full/stuffed, yeah? The HK milk tea is sweet so you may want to ask for less condensed milk, and the hot Coke w/ginger & lemon is good for a cough.
author: Peter L.

description:
It's authentic Hong Kong style cafe food and the bake and grilled spaghetti are awesome. Had the baked fish and pork chop combination and the pork chop is juicy and tasty. 

The portions here is huge! Some reviewers think that the food is pricier than other Asian place. Absolutely NOT!

For $10 you get a big portion entree with the following:

1) Dinner roll ( not some crappy hard dinner roll mind you! It's soft, warm and fresh, it's homely awesomeness.

2) cup of soup. (we had minestrone and its 7/10 )

3) drink, I had the Hong Kong milk tea and it's better than a lot I have had in the bay area.

4) finally choice of dessert - red bean soup or jello 

Now that's a five course meal for $10. Take that bozos!
author: Tommy W.

description:
[M]ona: 4 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 Stars
Average: 3.75 Stars

+ Open Late
+ New Staff
+ Good Service
+ Accepts Credit Cards
 
[W] Tonight we shared a Tomato and Ketchup Fried Rice and also had the Hong Kong Style Steamed Rolls for an appetizer. The appetizer was pretty good actually. It had hoisin, oyster sauce, and hot sauce on it as well as sesame seeds. It's definitely a nice little snack to pick on. Our main entree was pretty good as well. It had some ham and pineapples in it as well so it didn't make the rice too dry. When you come here, it's kind of a plus if you can speak Cantonese for the waitresses so they can understand you better.
 
The last time we came here, I tried ordering more sauce for my dish in English and they didn't understand what that was so yea. It also seems as if they have a new staff also because all the waitresses are different from the ones in the past. Overall, not too bad at all.
author: Mona C.

description: Love this place, took my friends here and they also feel in love with their food. I always get the hong Kong style chicken with cream sauce and pastA. It's one of the best place to eat in sf.
author: Alex C.

description:
I like this place. It's borderline wannabe hipster HK dessert cafe and borderline cafe for old people.

Regardless, this place serves good portions of food for cheap!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I LIke it!
Been wanting to try this place out for awhile. Went for dinner tonight. Restaurant is clean inside which is a plus for a Chinese place. Menu was pretty comprehensive, lots of stuff to try out. Service was fast and food was tasty. 

Tried portuguese Chicken with Spaghetti (wish it came with veggies) and others had steak, noodles, and chicken with onions. Everything was tasty, and fresh tasting. Came with soup and jello and milk tea too. Good flavor on the meats and great portion sizes too.

Can't want to come back again!
author: Ken L.

description:
Ok so times have changed since I last visited S&E, yes the buns and soup they give you with your meal still is the same but there is something different now.

The food, the food is delicious. Yes there were times where I came here for a drunken meal and of course food when you are drunk will always taste good. But even when I was sober the food held up.

This is now my place to go for late night hunger. They are open till 2:30 which is fairly late and the food they serve is 100 times better than ABC. 

Think of S&E as a nicer HK Cafe, one that serves good food with big portions with reasonable pricing. You can really taste the difference in cooking from back then till now.
author: phillip w.

description:
Topping was good - rice is broken and old.
Pork was grilled on stale oil.

Cheap though.
author: Koalie W.

description:
I would give this place a solid 3-star.

+ Big portions
+ Powerful milk tea
+ Nice waiters
+ Good soup and dessert. The bun/bao that came with it is delicious. I liked it so much, I accidentally ate my pastor's, too. Boy, do I feel bad. 
+ Good place to come if you want to hang out for a long time.

- I got the baked pork chop with onions and gravy over rice. It came with some steamed broccoli, which I wish I had more of. It was decent, but nothing I'd dream about at night.
- Also, they wouldn't let me order off the kid menu. since I wasn't 10 or under.  I guess I can't fault them for that... hehe.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Went with our good friends for a hearty lunch.  Ordered the chicken wings, curry fishball, singapore rice sticks, pork chops, eggs ham and pork and snapper.  Food portions were generous and flavorful.  Prices are reasonable.  You can see why there is a base of customers who return periodically.

Comment service:  even for a chinese restaurant, this was very poor.  had to ask for tea 5 times.  sought clarifications on the menu and the waitress responded with a smirk.  do no go here if you want service.
author: Bill L.

description: Food is good. Open  until  1am. Compare  to ABC cafe here is more comfortable and quite.
author: Yan C.

description: took awhile for food to come out; not all dishes were served at the same time  food wasnt too special but its pretty cheap if youre craving chinese food. for a party of 4, the total was roughly $35..pretty good price.
author: Grace O.

description: This place is def a good place if you want a late night snack or just a fast place to grab a good meal. I love their noodles and sauce that comes with it. The rice plates look amazing as well. I really like their pork chop over noodles, with white sauce. This place never lets me DOWN! Also this place accepts card which rarely many asian places dont. I would much much rather come here to eat then ABC! This place is clean, good, and the service is GREAT! Everything is always made good and served out, takeout is fast and parking is not as bad if you find it along taravel not 19th street ;].
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I dont care for anything here, but THE MA'S SPECIAL RICE (LO MO FAN....yum meaning MOM RICE) It is so good! Comes in a big bowl of rice with mince beef, onions, bell pepper, and an egg. 

Price is not bad since you get bread, soup, tea or coffee, and a dessert.
author: Karen H.

description:
Chinese Cafe Restaurant for weekday dinner is the way to go. Quick and easy. This place is a solid 3.5 stars.

For this restaurant, each dinner dish included a fresh dinner roll, soup of the day mini bowl, choice of rice or spaghetti and coffee or tea or milktea.
Our dinner was: 
* Grilled Pork Chops with House Sauce and White Rice $9.95 (4 of 5) The dish came with two boneless pork chops. They were good portion and very moist and juicy. It was a very tasty piece of pork steak. The house sauce was mediocre. I prefer pepper sauce with my pork chops, but the menu didn't list it, so I assumed they don't serve it. The side vegetables were an assortment of dark and leafy greens and heavily boiled in salt and garlic. It was pretty salty, but fine when I ate it with the rice. 
* Oven Baked Pork Chops with Tomato Sauce over Fettuccine $9.95 (3 of 5) The dish came out with a baked top. Be warned-hot plate. The pork chops were sliced and I found minced celery and onions in the tomato sauce. It was good, but nothing spectacular. 

I think my pan fried pork chops were better than the oven baked chops because they were not sliced and retained their meat juice and moisture. 

Onto the sides, I did enjoy their dinner roll (5 of 5). It was a really yummy dinner roll. Fluffy and lightly sweetened. LIke hawaiian buns, but not really. 
The daily soup was corn and egg flower soup (2 of 5). It was really watered down and really peppery. Not the highlight of the meal.  
Lastly, the meal included dessert. The choice was a cut of J-E-L-L-O or small bowl of red bean tapioca sweetened. We both choose the tapioca (2 of 5), but it was like the daily soup. The dessert was watered down. 

This café serves better quality meat, but has no daily specials. The price starts at $9.95 and goes up from there. It is nice and clean. So if you are up for paying $10+ for a Chinese café meal, this is the place to go. 

FYI, no extra charge for boxing your leftovers.
author: Janice T.

description: Typical Cantonese cafe. My fav here is the creamy mushroom soup. Very casual and cozy place with family or friends.
author: Samantha V.

description:
Man, I've been missing out on this Sunset gem for quite some time now!!  Back in days, we would always hit up S&E after a night of partying since they are open till 2am everyday.  However, it's been awhile since I have visited this place and boy, am I glad I did!

They did a complete facelift, definitely an improvement with a much more modern feel, I like!  :)  I cannot tell you when the last time I was here, but it must have been awhile (I feel so bad that I've been missing out on something so good and so close for so long!).  Menu item is still pretty much the same, your typical Chinese/American baked spaghetti and rice joint, but man, their wait staff is far better than any service I have ever gotten at ABC or other café joints with the same caliber.  I cannot say enough about how impressed I was with their service!  Granted, you don't expect much service from Chinese places, especially during late night when everyone is tired and cannot wait to go home.  However, that was not the case here.  It was 11pm on a Sunday night, 2 waitress and 2 owners in the back.  Everyone was working hard and super perky!  The waitresses were both super friendly and kept on coming over to check if we needed refills on our milk teas.  That alone sold me, I didn't have to wave them down for stuff, they were so attentive on their own!

Since there were only 2 of us and it was so late in the night, we just ordered a baked chicken steak over rice and a beef stew lo mein with thick egg noodles.  Both dishes were very flavorful and more than enough for the two of us, especially since the baked chicken steak came with bread and soup as well.  

I'm definitely going to make more of an effort to come here more often!
author: Janetto L.

description: Service is not the fastest but decent. Love their spaghetti and Hong Kong style dishes. They feed my cravings and I will definitely come back!
author: Karen J.

description: Came here on a Friday night around midnight with a group of about 35.  Service was great and while food prices are slightly higher than average, everyone was given bread, soup, milk tea, and dessert regardless of orders.  Portions are gracious and most dishes came out promptly.  I really enjoyed the Ma's Special and could only finish half.  Refills on water and milk tea were prompt and frequent without needing to be requested.  I guess my fellowship frequents this place fairly regularly, so I heard we also got 15% off our bill.  Down to come back and try other things!  I should also note that they were more than willing to rearrange tables to accommodate bigger group seating.
author: Christopher L.

description:
My first time here! I've heard lots of good things about them, but did not get a chance to try until now. 

Ambiance: Casual. HK style cafe.

Service: Regular. 

Food: We ordered a bunch of dishes including the porkchops with spaghetti and cod with creamy white sauce on rice. Everyone got a bread roll, soup and milk tea. Portions are pretty big and the food is yummy. 

I'd definitely come back here again even though it's a bit on the pricier end for chinese food.
author: Sharon G.

description:
I used to come here more often but recently I noticed the price change but depending on what time you come, service can be good or bad. I had times where it took an hour to get the bill or the food or just to order while others it very quick and the servers were on it. 
I only had one bad experience which was with a lady who could not understand english so well and got us the wrong order because of that. Other than that! they sometimes give you complimentary soup and dessert and are generally very kind :). And although the prices went but I am still appreciative that for most of their entree order can feed two people and still allow the two of us to leave feeling full and happy.
author: Vivian A.

description:
I would give them 0 stars based on tonights experience. In the past I've gone with friends (up to 8 people) on busy nights and have never had any problems with orders, so tonight when we stopped in at 11:30pm with 6 people, I didn't expect any issues. Our food all arrived at different times, with the last meal taking at least 50minutes from the first meal. We asked for a discount or refund for the last meal, because we had all finished eating, and it's ridiculous to think it's okay to deliver a meal so late compared to everyone else's.
